alert.note: Alert for Juniata (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 10:34PM EDT until August 13 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Cumberland, Dauphin, Juniata, Lebanon, Perry and Schuylkill. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1031 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to multiple rounds of thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen over the past 90 minutes. - Additional rainfall of 0.5 to 1 inches is expected over the area during the next 1 to 2 hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Harrisburg, Linglestown, Enola, Skyline View, Valley View, Millersburg, Marysville, Pine Grove, Lykens, Tremont, Newport, Duncannon, Elizabethville, Williamstown, Fredericksburg, Tower City, New Bloomfield, Spruce Hill, Donaldson and New Buffalo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
